translations.text: If they turn away (you are not responsible); We have not appointed you a warden over them. Your duty is to deliver the message. When We let man taste of Our favours he begins to exult; but if misfortune befalls him, as a consequence of his own deeds, man is surely then ungrateful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So if they turn away from you, We have not sent you as a guardian over them; upon you is nothing but to convey (the message); and when We make man taste some mercy from Us, he rejoices upon it; and if some harm reaches them because of what their own hands have sent before, thereupon man is ungrateful!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But if they turn away, We sent thee not to be a guardian over them. It is for thee only to deliver the Message. And when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but if some evil befalls him for that his own hands have forwarded, then surely man is unthankful.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: If then they turn away, then We have not sent thee to be a warden over them, on thee is naught but preaching. And verily We! when We cause man to taste of mercy from Us he exulteth thereat; and if an ill befalleth them because of that which their hands have sent on, then verily man becometh ingrate.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But if they turn away (O Muhammad SAW from the Islamic Monotheism, which you have brought to them). We have not sent you (O Muhammad SAW) as a Hafiz (protector) over them (i.e. to take care of their deeds and to recompense them). Your duty is to convey (the Message). And verily, when We cause man to taste of Mercy from Us, he rejoices thereat, but when some ill befalls them because of the deeds which their hands have sent forth, then verily, man (becomes) ingrate!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But if they turn away—We did not send you as a guardian over them. Your only duty is communication. Whenever We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but when misfortune befalls them, as a consequence of what their hands have perpetrated, man turns blasphemous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), if they turn away from the Truth, know that We did not send you to them as their overseer. Your task is only to convey (the Message). Indeed when We give man a taste of Our Mercy, he exults in it. But if any misfortune afflicts them on account of their deeds, man is utterly ungrateful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But if they turn away, We have not sent you as a Hafiz over them. Your duty is to convey. And verily, when We cause man to taste of mercy from Us, he rejoices there at; but when some evil befalls them because of the deeds which their hands have sent forth, then verily, man (becomes) ingrate!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But if they are averse, We have not sent thee as a warder over them. Thine is only to convey (the message). And lo! when We cause man to taste of mercy from Us he exulteth therefor. And if some evil striketh them because of that which their own hands have sent before, then lo! man is an ingrate.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But if they disregard [your warnings], [keep in mind that] We have not sent you as their keeper. Your duty is only to communicate. Indeed when We let man taste Our mercy, he boasts about it; but should an ill visit him because of what his hands have sent ahead, then man is very ungrateful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But if they turn away, We have not sent you (Prophet Muhammad) to be their (compulsory) guardian. It is only for you to deliver (the Message). When We give the human a taste of Our Mercy, he rejoices because of it; but when, because of what he has earned, evil befalls him, the human is ungrateful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), if they turn away from your message, know that We have not sent you as their keeper. Your duty is only to deliver the message. When We grant mercy to the human being, he becomes joyous, but when he is afflicted by evil as a result of his own deeds, he proves to be ungrateful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But if they turn aside, We have not sent you as a watcher over them; on you is only to deliver (the message); and surely when We make man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices thereat; and if an evil afflicts them on account of what their hands have already done, then-surely man is ungrateful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fain aAAradoo fama arsalnaka AAalayhim hafeethan in AAalayka illa albalaghu wainna itha athaqna alinsana minna rahmatan fariha biha wain tusibhum sayyiatun bima qaddamat aydeehim fainna alinsana kafoorun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Now if they turn away, We have not sent you [O Prophet] as their keeper: your responsibility is only to convey the message. Man is such that when We let him taste Our mercy, he exults in it, but if an evil befalls him which is his own doing, he becomes utterly ungrateful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If then they run away, We have not sent thee as a guard over them. Thy duty is but to convey (the Message). And truly, when We give man a taste of a Mercy from Ourselves, he doth exult thereat, but when some ill happens to him, on account of the deeds which his hands have sent forth, truly then is man ungrateful!

verses.text: لِلَّهِ‌ مُلْکُ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضِ‌ يَخْلُقُ‌ مَا يَشَاءُ يَهَبُ‌ لِمَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ إِنَاثاً وَ يَهَبُ‌ لِمَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ الذُّکُورَ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مالکیّت و فرمانروایی آسمان ها و زمین فقط در سیطره خداست، هر چه را بخواهد می آفریند، به هر کس بخواهد دختر عطا می کند و به هر کس بخواهد پسر می بخشد؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از آن خداست فرمانروايى آسمانها و زمين. هر چه بخواهد مى‌آفريند. به هر كه بخواهد دختر مى‌بخشد و به هر كه بخواهد پسر مى‌بخشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرمانروايى آسمان‌ها و زمين از آن اوست، هر چه بخواهد مى‌آفريند، به هر كه خواهد دخترانى مى‌بخشد و هر كه را خواهد پسرانى مى‌دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمانروايى [مطلق‌] آسمانها و زمين از آنِ خداست؛ هر چه بخواهد مى‌آفريند؛ به هر كس بخواهد فرزند دختر و به هركس بخواهد فرزند پسر مى‌دهد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تنها خدا راست ملک آسمانها و زمین، هر چه بخواهد می‌آفریند، به هر که خواهد فرزندان اناث (دختر) و به هر که خواهد فرزندان ذکور (پسر) عطا می‌کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مالکیّت و حاکمیّت آسمانها و زمین از آن خدا است. هرچه بخواهد می‌آفریند. به هر کس که بخواهد دخترانی می‌بخشد و به هر کس که بخواهد پسرانی عطاء می‌کند. [[«مُلْکُ»: مالکیّت و حاکمیّت. کشور و مملکت. «إِنَاثاً»: جمع أُنثی، دختران (نگا: نساء / 117). «الذُّکُورَ»: جمع ذَکَر، پسران (نگا: انعام / 39).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمانروایی آسمانها و زمین از آن خداوند است، هر چه می‌خواهد می‌آفریند، به هرکس که خواهد [فرزند] دختر بخشد، و به هرکس که خواهد [فرزند] پسر

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مالکیّت و حاکمیّت آسمانها و زمین از آن خداست؛ هر چه را بخواهد می‌آفریند؛ به هر کس اراده کند دختر می‌بخشد و به هر کس بخواهد پسر،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: خدا را است پادشاهی آسمانها و زمین بیافرد هر چه خواهد ببخشد هر که را خواهد مادگانی و ببخشد بدانکه خواهد نران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خداى راست پادشاهى آسمانها و زمين آنچه خواهد مى‌آفريند به هر كه خواهد دختران مى‌بخشد و به هر كه خواهد پسران مى‌بخشد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمانرواییِ (مطلق) آسمان‌ها و زمین تنها از خداست‌؛ هر چه بخواهد می‌آفریند؛ برای‌هر کس بخواهد فرزندِ دختر و برای هرکس بخواهد فرزندِ پسر می‌بخشد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatsoever He wills, bestows daughters on whosoever He will, and gives sons to whom He choose.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For Allah only is the kingship of the heavens and the earth; He creates whatever He wills; He may bestow daughters to whomever He wills, and sons to whomever He wills.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: To God belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He will; He gives to whom He will females, and He gives to whom He will males

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah's is the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He createth whatsoever He Will. He bestoweth females upon whomsoever He will, and bestoweth males upon whomsoever He Will.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills. He bestows female (offspring) upon whom He wills, and bestows male (offspring) upon whom He wills.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills. He grants daughters to whomever He wills, and He grants sons to whomever He wills.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The dominion of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He creates whatever He pleases. He grants females to whomever He pleases and males to whomever He pleases,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills. He bestows female upon whom He wills, and bestows male upon whom He wills.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He createth what He will. He bestoweth female (offspring) upon whom He will, and bestoweth male (offspring) upon whom He will;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wishes; He gives females to whomever He wishes, and males to whomever He wishes,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: To Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He will. He gives females to whom He will and males to whom He will.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what he wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: To God belongs the heavens and the earth. He created whatever He wanted. He grants males, female, or pairs of.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He pleases; He grants to whom He pleases daughters and grants to whom He pleases sons.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lillahi mulku alssamawati waalardi yakhluqu ma yashao yahabu liman yashao inathan wayahabu liman yashao alththukoora

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God has control of the heavens and the earth; He creates whatever He will -- He grants female offspring to whoever He will, male to whoever He will,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills (and plans). He bestows (children) male or female according to His Will (and Plan),

verses.text: أَوْ يُزَوِّجُهُمْ‌ ذُکْرَاناً وَ إِنَاثاً وَ يَجْعَلُ‌ مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ عَقِيماً إِنَّهُ‌ عَلِيمٌ‌ قَدِيرٌ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا پسران و دختران را با هم به آنان می دهد و هر که را بخواهد نازا می کند؛ یقیناً او دانا و تواناست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و يا هم پسر دهد و هم دختر. و هر كس را بخواهد عقيم مى‌گرداند، زيرا او دانا و تواناست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا [اگر بخواهد] آنها را پسران و دختران [هر دو را] مى‌دهد، و هر كه را بخواهد نازا مى‌كند. به راستى او داناى تواناست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا آنها را پسر[ان‌] و دختر[انى‌] توأم با يكديگر مى‌گرداند، و هر كه را بخواهد عقيم مى‌سازد. اوست داناى توانا.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا در یک رحم فرزندان پسر و دختر قرار می‌دهد، و هر که را خواهد عقیم (نازا) می‌گرداند، که او (به صلاح خلق) دانا و (به هر چه خواهد) تواناست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و یا این که هم پسران می‌دهد و هم دختران. و خدا هر که را بخواهد نازا می‌کند. او بس آگاه و توانا است. [[«یُزَوِّجُهُمْ»: آنها را با هم گرد می‌آورد و جفت هم می‌کند. یعنی به برخیها گاهی پسر و گاهی دختر عطاء می‌کند. یا این که دوقلوی پسر یا دختر و یا پسر و دختر می‌بخشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا به آنان هم پسر و هم دختر دهد، و هرکس را که خواهد سترون گرداند، که او دانای تواناست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا (اگر بخواهد) پسر و دختر -هر دو- را برای آنان جمع میکند و هر کس را بخواهد عقیم می‌گذارد؛ زیرا که او دانا و قادر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا جُفت کندشان نرانی و مادگانی و بگرداند هر که را خواهد نازا همانا او است دانای توانا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا آنان را پسران و دختران هر دو مى‌دهد، و هر كه را خواهد نازا و بى‌فرزند مى‌گرداند، كه او دانا و تواناست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا برایشان پسران و دخترانی (توأمان) با یکدیگر می‌گرداند و هر که را بخواهد عقیم می‌سازد و همواره اوست بسی دانای بسیار توانا.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: On some He bestows both sons and daughters, and some He leaves issueless. He is all-knowing and all-powerful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or may mix them, the sons and daughters; and may make barren whomever He wills; indeed He is All Knowing, Able.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: or He couples them, both males and females; and He makes whom He will barren. Surely He is All-knowing, All-powerful.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or He conjoineth them males and females; and He maketh barren whomsoever He will; verily He is Knower, Petent.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or He bestows both males and females, and He renders barren whom He wills. Verily, He is the All-Knower and is Able to do all things.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or He combines them together, males and females; and He renders whomever He wills sterile. He is Knowledgeable and Capable.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: or grants them a mix of males and females, and causes whomever He pleases to be barren. He is All- Knowing, All-Powerful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or He bestows both males and females, and He renders barren whom He wills. Verily, He is the All-Knower and is Able (to do all things).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or He mingleth them, males and females, and He maketh barren whom He will. Lo! He is Knower, Powerful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: or He combines them males and females, and makes sterile whomever He wishes. Indeed, He is all-knowing, all-powerful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, He couples them, both males and females, and to others, if He will, He makes them barren. Surely, He is the Knower, the Powerful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: offspring to whomever He wants. He causes whomever He wants to be childless. He is All-Knowing and All-Powerful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or He makes them of both sorts, male and female; and He makes whom He pleases barren; surely He is the Knowing, the Powerful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aw yuzawwijuhum thukranan wainathan wayajAAalu man yashao AAaqeeman innahu AAaleemun qadeerun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: or both male and female, and He leaves whoever He will barren; He is all-knowing and all powerful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or He bestows both males and females, and He leaves barren whom He will: for He is full of Knowledge and Power.

verses.text: وَ مَا کَانَ‌ لِبَشَرٍ أَنْ‌ يُکَلِّمَهُ‌ اللَّهُ‌ إِلاَّ وَحْياً أَوْ مِنْ‌ وَرَاءِ حِجَابٍ‌ أَوْ يُرْسِلَ‌ رَسُولاً فَيُوحِيَ‌ بِإِذْنِهِ‌ مَا يَشَاءُ إِنَّهُ‌ عَلِيٌ‌ حَکِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هیچ بشری را نسزد که خدا با او سخن گوید، مگر از راه وحی یا از پشت حجاب غیب یا رسولی [چون فرشته] می فرستد؛ پس فرشته به اذن او آنچه را بخواهد وحی می کند؛ یقیناً او بلند مرتبه و حکیم است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ بشرى را نرسد كه خدا جز به وحى يا از آن سوى پرده، با او سخن گويد. يا فرشته‌اى مى‌فرستد تا به فرمان او هر چه بخواهد به او وحى كند. او بلند پايه و حكيم است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ بشرى را نرسد كه خدا با او سخن بگويد جز [از راه‌] وحى يا از فراسوى حجابى، يا رسولى بفرستد كه به اذن او هر چه بخواهد وحى كند. همانا او والا مقام حكيم است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ بشرى را نرسد كه خدا با او سخن گويد جز [از راه‌] وحى يا از فراسوى حجابى، يا فرستاده‌اى بفرستد و به اذن او هر چه بخواهد وحى نمايد. آرى، اوست بلندمرتبه سنجيده‌كار.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ بشری را یارای آن نباشد که خدا با او سخن گوید مگر به وحی (و الهام خدا) یا از پس پرده غیب عالم (و حجاب ملکوت جهان) یا رسولی (از فرشتگان عالم بالا) فرستد تا به امر خدا هر چه او خواهد وحی کند، که او خدای بلند مرتبه حکیم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ انسانی را نسزد که خدا با او سخن بگوید، مگر از طریق وحی (به قلب، به گونه‌ی الهام در بیداری، و یا خواب در غیربیداری) یا از پس پرده‌ای (از موانع طبیعی) و یا این که خداوند قاصدی را (به نام جبرئیل) بفرستد و او به فرمان آفریدگار آنچه را که خدا می‌خواهد (به پیغمبران) وحی کند. وی والا و کار بجا است. [[«مَا کَانَ لِبَشَرٍ ...»: ارتباط خدا با جهان انسانیّت، از سه راه امکان‌پذیر است و بس: الف - وحی، یا القای به قلب، به گونه الهام در بیداری یا به صورت خواب در وقت خفتن (نگا: قصص / 7). ب - از پشت حجاب (نگا: قصص / 30 - 42). ج - ارسال فرشته وحی به سوی پیغمبران (نگا: نساء / 163).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هیچ بشری را نرسد که خداوند با او سخن گوید مگر از راه وحی، یا از پشت پرده‌ای، یا فرشته‌ای بفرستد و آنچه می‌خواهد به اذن خویش وحی کند که او بلندمرتبه فرزانه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و شایسته هیچ انسانی نیست که خدا با او سخن گوید، مگر از راه وحی یا از پشت حجاب، یا رسولی می‌فرستد و بفرمان او آنچه را بخواهد وحی می‌کند؛ چرا که او بلندمقام و حکیم است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نبوده است بشری را که سخن گویدش خدا مگر سروشی یا از پشت پرده یا فرستد پیکی پس وحی کند به دستورش آنچه خواهد همانا او است فرازنده حکیم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هيچ آدمى را نرسد كه خداى با او سخن گويد مگر به وحى يا از پس پرده، يا فرستاده‌اى- فرشته‌اى- فرستد پس به فرمان او آنچه خواهد [به وى‌] وحى كند. همانا او والا مرتبه و با حكمت است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ بشری را نرسیده است که خدا با او سخن گوید، جز به وحی، بدون پرده و حجاب یا از فراسوی حجابی. یا فرستاده‌ای بفرستد و به اذن او هر چه بخواهد وحی کند. به‌راستی اوست بلندمرتبه‌ا‌ی سنجیده‌کار.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is not given to man that God should speak to him except by suggestion or indirectly, or send a messenger to convey by His command whatsoever He please. He is all-high and all-wise.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is not for any human that Allah may speak to him except as a divine revelation or while the human is on this side of the veil of greatness, or that He sends an angel to reveal by His permission, whatever He wills; indeed He is Supreme, Wise.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It belongs not to any mortal that God should speak to him, except by revelation, or from behind a veil, or that He should send a messenger and he reveal whatsoever He will, by His leave; surely He is All-high, All-wise.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And it is not Possible for a human being that Allah should speak Unto him otherwise than by revelation or from behind a veil, or that He sendeth a messenger, so that he revealeth by His command whatsoever He will; verily He is Exalted, Wise.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It is not given to any human being that Allah should speak to him unless (it be) by Inspiration, or from behind a veil, or (that) He sends a Messenger to reveal what He wills by His Leave. Verily, He is Most High, Most Wise.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is not for any human that God should speak to him, except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger to reveal by His permission whatever He wills. He is All-High, All-Wise.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is not given to any human being that Allah should speak to him except through revelation, or from behind a veil, or that a messenger (an angel) be sent to him who reveals to him by Allah's leave whatever He wishes. He is All-High, Most Wise.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It is not given to any human being that Allah should speak to him unless (it be) by revelation, or from behind a veil, or (that) He sends a Messenger to reveal what He wills by His leave. Verily, He is Most High, Most Wise.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And it was not (vouchsafed) to any mortal that Allah should speak to him unless (it be) by revelation or from behind a veil, or (that) He sendeth a messenger to reveal what He will by His leave. Lo! He is Exalted, Wise.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is not [possible] for any human that Allah should speak to him except through revelation or from behind a veil, or send a messenger who reveals by His permission whatever He wishes. Indeed He is all-exalted, all-wise.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It does not belong to any human that Allah should speak to him except by Revelation, or from behind a veil, or that He sent a Messenger to revealwhatsoever He will by His Permission. He is the High, the Wise.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: To no mortal does God speak but through revelation, from behind a curtain, or by sending a Messenger who reveals, by His permission whatever He pleases. He is the Most High and the All-wise.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it is not for any mortal that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger and revealing by His permission what He pleases; surely He is High, Wise.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama kana libasharin an yukallimahu Allahu illa wahyan aw min warai hijabin aw yursila rasoolan fayoohiya biithnihi ma yashao innahu AAaliyyun hakeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is not granted to any human being that God should speak to him other than by revelation or from behind a veil, or by sending him a messenger, so that the messenger may reveal, by His command, whatsoever He will. Truly, He is exalted and wise.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is not fitting for a man that Allah should speak to him except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by the sending of a messenger to reveal, with Allah's permission, what Allah wills: for He is Most High, Most Wise.

verses.text: وَ کَذٰلِکَ‌ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْکَ‌ رُوحاً مِنْ‌ أَمْرِنَا مَا کُنْتَ‌ تَدْرِي‌ مَا الْکِتَابُ‌ وَ لاَ الْإِيمَانُ‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ جَعَلْنَاهُ‌ نُوراً نَهْدِي‌ بِهِ‌ مَنْ‌ نَشَاءُ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِنَا وَ إِنَّکَ‌ لَتَهْدِي‌ إِلَى‌ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همان گونه [که بر پیامبران پیشین وحی کردیم] روحی را [چون قرآن] از امر خود به تو وحی کردیم. تو [پیش از این] نمی دانستی کتاب و ایمان چیست؟ ولی آن [کتاب] را نوری قرار دادیم که هر کس از بندگانمان را بخواهیم به وسیله آن هدایت می کنیم؛ بی تردید تو [مردم را] به راهی راست هدایت می نمایی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همچنين كلام خود را به فرمان خود به تو وحى كرديم. تو نمى‌دانستى كتاب و ايمان چيست. ولى ما آن را نورى ساختيم تا هر يك از بندگانمان را كه بخواهيم بدان هدايت كنيم و تو به راه راست راه مى‌نمايى،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همين گونه ما روحى از امر خود را [به صورت قرآن‌] به تو وحى كرديم، [و گر نه‌] تو نمى‌دانستى كتاب چيست و ايمان كدام است؟ ولى ما آن را نورى ساختيم كه هر يك از بندگان خود را كه بخواهيم به وسيله آن هدايت مى‌كنيم، و بى‌ترديد تو [مردم را] به راه راست هداي

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: وهمين گونه، روحى از امر خودمان به سوى تو وحى كرديم. تو نمى‌دانستى كتاب چيست و نه ايمان [كدام است؟] ولى آن را نورى گردانيديم كه هر كه از بندگان خود را بخواهيم به وسيله آن راه مى‌نماييم، و به راستى كه تو به خوبى به راه راست هدايت مى‌كنى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همین گونه ما روح (و فرشته بزرگ) خود را به فرمان خویش (برای وحی) به تو فرستادیم، تو از آن پیش که وحی بر تو رسد نه دانستی کتاب (خدا) چیست و نه فهم کردی که راه ایمان و شرع کدام است و لیکن ما آن (کتاب و شرع) را نور (وحی و معرفت) گردانیدیم که هر کس از بندگان خود را بخواهیم به آن نور هدایت می‌کنیم و اینک تو (که به نور وحی ما هدایت یافتی خلق را) به راه راست هدایت خواهی کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همان گونه که به پیغمبران پیشین وحی کرده‌ایم، به تو نیز به فرمان خود جان را وحی کرده‌ایم (که قرآن نام دارد و مایه‌ی حیات دلها است. پیش از وحی) تو که نمی‌دانستی کتاب چیست و ایمان کدام، ولیکن ما قرآن را نور عظیمی نموده‌ایم که در پرتو آن هر کس از بندگان خویش را بخواهیم هدایت می‌بخشیم. تو قطعاً (مردمان را با این قرآن) به راه راست رهنمود می‌سازی. [[«کَذلِکَ»: همان گونه که به پیغمبران وحی کرده‌ایم. به همان سه شکلی که به پیغمبران وحی کرده‌ایم. «رُوحاً»: مراد قرآن است که به انسانها حیات جاودانه می‌بخشد (نگا: انفال / 24). یا مراد همه چیزهائی است که خدا بدو وحی فرموده است (نگا: نحل / 2). «الْکِتَابُ»: مراد قرآن است. «الإِیمَانُ»: ایمان. مراد تنها باور و تصدیق مجرّد نیست، بلکه مراد آگاهی کامل از ایمان و آشنائی به تفاصیل قوانین دینی است که با خود آورده است (نگا: بقره / 143). «نُوراً»: نور عظیمی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بدین‌سان [پیام و کتاب‌] روحبخشی از امر خویش به تو وحی کردیم، و تو پیشتر نمی‌دانستی کتاب چیست و ایمان چیست؟ ولی آن را همچون نوری گرداندیم که هرکس را از بندگان خویش که بخواهیم با آن هدایت می‌کنیم و بی‌گمان تو به راهی راست هدایت می‌کنی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان گونه (که بر پیامبران پیشین وحی فرستادیم) بر تو نیز روحی را بفرمان خود وحی کردیم؛ تو پیش از این نمی‌دانستی کتاب و ایمان چیست (و از محتوای قرآن آگاه نبودی)؛ ولی ما آن را نوری قرار دادیم که بوسیله آن هر کس از بندگان خویش را بخواهیم هدایت می‌کنیم؛ و تو مسلّماً به سوی راه راست هدایت می‌کنی.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بدینسان وحی فرستادیم بسوی تو روحی (روانی) را از امر ما نبودی بدانی چیست کتاب و نه ایمان و لیکن گردانیدیمش تابشی که رهبری کنیم بدان هر که را خواهیم از بندگان خود و همانا تو راهنمائی کنی بسوی راهی راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همچنين از فرمان خويش روحى- قرآن- را به تو وحى كرديم. تو نمى‌دانستى كه كتاب و ايمان چيست و ليكن ما آن را نورى ساختيم كه بدان هر كه را از بندگان خويش بخواهيم راه نماييم و هر آينه تو به راهى راست راه مى‌نمايى

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: وهمین‌گونه (جهان‌شمول و پایدار) از امر خودمان سوی تو روحی (جان‌فزا) وحی کردیم. تو نمی‌دانسته‌ای نه (این) کتاب و نه (این) ایمان چیست‌؟ ولی آن را نوری گردانیدیم که هر که از بندگان خود را بخواهیم با آن راه می‌نماییم. و به‌راستی تو همواره سوی راهی راست هدایت می‌کنی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So have We revealed to you the Qur'an by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture was before, nor (the laws of) faith. And We made it a light by which We show the way to those of Our creatures as We please; and you certainly guide them to the right path,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And this is how We sent the divine revelation to you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) – a life giving thing, by Our command; neither did you know the Book nor the detailed commands of religion, but We have made this Qur’an a light by which We guide whomever We will from Our bondmen; and indeed you surely do guide to the Straight Path.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We have revealed to thee a Spirit of Our bidding. Thou knewest not what the Book was, nor belief; but We made it a light, whereby We guide whom We will of Our servants. And thou, surely thou shalt guide unto a straight path --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Even so We have revealed Unto thee a spirit of Our command; thou knewest not whatsoever the Book was, nor whatsoever the faith; We have made it a light wherewith We guide whomsoever We will of Our bondmen. And verily thou guidest Unto a straight path.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And thus We have sent to you (O Muhammad SAW) Ruhan (an Inspiration, and a Mercy) of Our Command. You knew not what is the Book, nor what is Faith? But We have made it (this Quran) a light wherewith We guide whosoever of Our slaves We will. And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are indeed guiding (mankind) to the Straight Path (i.e. Allah's religion of Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We thus inspired you spiritually, by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture is, nor what faith is, but We made it a light, with which We guide whomever We will of Our servants. You surely guide to a straight path.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Even so We revealed to you, (O Prophet), a spirit by Our command. (Ere to that) you knew neither what the Book nor what the faith was. But We made that spirit a light whereby We guide those of Our servants whom We please to the Right Way. Surely you are directing people to the Right Way,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And thus We have sent to you Ruh of Our command. You knew not what is the Book, nor what is Faith. But We have made it a light wherewith We guide whosoever of Our servants We will. And verily, you are indeed guiding to a straight path.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And thus have We inspired in thee (Muhammad) a Spirit of Our command. Thou knewest not what the Scripture was, nor what the Faith. But We have made it a light whereby We guide whom We will of Our bondmen. And lo! thou verily dost guide unto a right path,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thus have We imbued you with a Spirit of Our command. You did not know what the Book is, nor what is faith; but We made it a light that We may guide by its means whomever We wish of Our servants. Indeed, you guide to a straight path,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We have revealed to you (Prophet Muhammad) a spirit (the revelation of the Koran) from Our Ordinance. You did not know what the Book was, nor belief, but We made it a light whereby We guide those of Our worshipers whom We will. And you (Prophet Muhammad), you, surely guide to a Straight Path.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And thus We have revealed to you an inspiration of Our command. You did not know what is the Book or [what is] faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Muhammad], you guide to a straight path -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus, We have revealed a Spirit to you, (Muhammad), by Our command. Before, you did not even know what a Book or Faith was, but We have made the Quran as a light by which We guide whichever of Our servants We want. You certainly guide (people) to the right path,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And thus did We reveal to you an inspired book by Our command. You did not know what the Book was, nor (what) the faith (was), but We made it a light, guiding thereby whom We please of Our servants; and most surely you show the way to the right path:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakathalika awhayna ilayka roohan min amrina ma kunta tadree ma alkitabu wala aleemanu walakin jaAAalnahu nooran nahdee bihi man nashao min AAibadina wainnaka latahdee ila siratin mustaqeemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have thus revealed a Spirit to you [Prophet] by Our command: you knew neither the Scripture nor the faith, but We made it a light, guiding with it whoever We will of Our servants. You are indeed guiding to the straight path,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And thus have We, by Our Command, sent inspiration to thee: thou knewest not (before) what was Revelation, and what was Faith; but We have made the (Qur'an) a Light, wherewith We guide such of Our servants as We will; and verily thou dost guide (men) to the Straight Way,-

verses.text: صِرَاطِ اللَّهِ‌ الَّذِي‌ لَهُ‌ مَا فِي‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ مَا فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ أَلاَ إِلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ تَصِيرُ الْأُمُورُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: راه آن خدایی که آنچه در آسمان ها و آنچه در زمین است، فقط در سیطره مالکیّت و فرمانروایی اوست. آگاه باشید! که همه امور به سوی خدا بازمی گردد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: راه آن خدايى كه از آن اوست هر چه در آسمانها و زمين است. آگاه باشيد كه همه كارها به خدا باز مى‌گردد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: راه خدايى كه آنچه در آسمان‌ها و آنچه در زمين است از آن اوست. آگاه باش كه كارها به خدا باز مى‌گردد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: راه همان خدايى كه آنچه در آسمانها و آنچه در زمين است از آنِ اوست. هش‌دار كه [همه‌] كارها به خدا بازمى‌گردد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یعنی به راه خدا همان خدایی که هر چه در آسمانها و زمین است همه ملک اوست، الا بدانید که رجوع تمام امور (عالم آفرینش) به سوی خداست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: راه خدائی که متعلّق بدو است همه‌ی چیزهائی که در آسمانها و زمین است. هان! همه‌ی کارها به خدا بازمی‌گردد (و هر کاری تحت نظارت دقیق او و با اطّلاع و اجازه‌ی او انجام می‌پذیرد، و هر چیزی بدو مربوط است). [[«صِرَاطٍ»: بدل از (صِرَاطٍ) آیه قبلی است. «اَلا إِلَی‌اللهِ تَصِیرُ الأُمُورُ»: (نگا: بقره / 285، آل‌عمران / 28، مائده / 18). «تَصِیرُ»: منتهی می‌گردد. برمی‌گردد. رجوع و برگشت دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: راه خداوندی که آنچه در آسمانها و آنچه در زمین است، او راست، بدانید که کارها به سوی خداوند باز می‌گردد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: راه خداوندی که تمامی آنچه در آسمانها و آنچه در زمین است از آن اوست؛ آگاه باشید که همه کارها تنها بسوی خدا بازمی‌گردد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: راه خدائی که او را است آنچه در آسمانها و آنچه در زمین است همانا بسوی خدا بازگردند کارها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: راه آن خدايى كه او راست آنچه در آسمانها و آنچه در زمين است. آگاه باشيد كه همه كارها به خدا باز مى‌گردد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: راه (همان) خدایی که آنچه در آسمان‌ها و آنچه در زمین است تنها از آنِ اوست. هان! همه‌ی کارها و (همه‌ی) چیزها تنها سوی خدا بازمی‌گردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The path of God to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And will not all things go back to God?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The path of Allah – the One to Whom only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; pay heed! Towards Allah only do all matters return.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: the path of God, to whom belongs whatsoever is in the heavens, and whatsoever is in the earth. Surely unto God all things come home.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The path of Allah, Whose is whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. Lo! Unto Allah trend all affairs.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The Path of Allah, to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Verily, all the matters at the end go to Allah (for decision).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The path of God, to whom belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Indeed, to God all matters revert.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the Way of Allah, to Whom belongs the dominion of all that is in the heavens and the earth. Lo, it is to Allah that all things ultimately revert.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The path of Allah to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. Verily, all matters at the end go to Allah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The path of Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. Do not all things reach Allah at last?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: the path of Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Indeed all matters return to Allah!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The Path of Allah, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Surely, to Allah all things return.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The path of Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah do [all] matters evolve.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: the path of God who is the owner of all that is in the heavens and the earth. To God certainly do all matters return.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The path of Allah, Whose is whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth; now surely to Allah do all affairs eventually come.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Sirati Allahi allathee lahu ma fee alssamawati wama fee alardi ala ila Allahi taseeru alomooru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the path of God, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth. Indeed all matters return eventually to God.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Way of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth. Behold (how) all affairs tend towards Allah!
